result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kermit Steven Morales

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kermit Steven Morales not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Kermit Steven Morales.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense request a resolution date. Court adjourns matter for plea/sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kermit Steven Morales in court by video with Attorney Zachary Wroblewski who appears in person.  Defendant Kermit Steven Morales in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Retainer.  Received and Filed.  nk

Adjustment Number: 22A 071209,
Payable Number: 1022493,
Receipt Number: 22RP030320,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Kermit Steven Morales not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; in another court for a motion hearing. Defense moves to dismiss; denied. Defense Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with C.N.R.; T.C.S.;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kermit Steven Morales in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Kermit Steven Morales in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kermit Steven Morales appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25. Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2 and 3.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
